verses.verse: Now it came to pass in the days<WH3117> when the judges<WH8199> ruled<WH8199>, that there was a famine<WH7458> in the land<WH776>. And a certain man<WH376> of Beth-lehem-judah<WH1035><WH3063> went<WH3212> to sojourn<WH1481> in the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>, he, and his wife<WH802>, and his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>.

And the name<WH8034> of the man<WH376> was Elimelech<WH458>, and the name<WH8034> of his wife<WH802> Naomi<WH5281>, and the name<WH8034> of his two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> Mahlon<WH4248> and Chilion<WH3630>, Ephrathites<WH673> of Beth-lehem-judah<WH1035><WH3063>. And they came<WH935> into the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>, and continued there.
And Elimelech<WH458> Naomi's<WH5281> husband<WH376> died<WH4191>; and she was left<WH7604>, and her two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>.

And they took<WH5375> them wives<WH802> of the women<WH802> of Moab<WH4125>; the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Orpah<WH6204>, and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH8145> Ruth<WH7327>: and they dwelled<WH3427> there about ten<WH6235> years<WH8141>.
And Mahlon<WH4248> and Chilion<WH3630> died<WH4191> also both<WH8147> of them; and the woman<WH802> was left<WH7604> of her two<WH8147> sons<WH3206> and her husband<WH376>.

¶ Then she arose<WH6965> with her daughters in law<WH3618>, that she might return<WH7725> from the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>: for she had heard<WH8085> in the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124> how that the LORD<WH3068> had visited<WH6485> his people<WH5971> in giving<WH5414> them bread<WH3899>.

Wherefore she went forth<WH3318> out of the place<WH4725> where she was, and her two<WH8147> daughters in law<WH3618> with her; and they went<WH3212> on the way<WH1870> to return<WH7725> unto the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>.

And Naomi<WH5281> said<WH559> unto her two<WH8147> daughters in law<WH3618>, Go<WH3212>, return<WH7725> each<WH802> to her mother's<WH517> house<WH1004>: the LORD<WH3068> deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> with you, as ye have dealt<WH6213> with the dead<WH4191>, and with me.

The LORD<WH3068> grant<WH5414> you that ye may find<WH4672> rest<WH4496>, each<WH802> of you in the house<WH1004> of her husband<WH376>. Then she kissed<WH5401> them; and they lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.
And they said<WH559> unto her, Surely we will return<WH7725> with thee unto thy people<WH5971>.
And Naomi<WH5281> said<WH559>, Turn again<WH7725>, my daughters<WH1323>: why will ye go<WH3212> with me? are there yet any more sons<WH1121> in my womb<WH4578>, that they may be your husbands<WH582>?

Turn again<WH7725>, my daughters<WH1323>, go<WH3212> your way; for I am too old<WH2204> to have an husband<WH376>. If I should say<WH559>, I have<WH3426> hope<WH8615>, if I should have an husband<WH376> also to night<WH3915>, and should also bear<WH3205> sons<WH1121>;

Would ye tarry<WH7663> for them<WH3860> till they were grown<WH1431>? would ye stay<WH5702> for them<WH3860> from having husbands<WH376>? nay, my daughters<WH1323>; for it grieveth<WH4843> me much<WH3966> for your sakes that the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> is gone out<WH3318> against me.
And they lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and wept again<WH1058>: and Orpah<WH6204> kissed<WH5401> her mother in law<WH2545>; but Ruth<WH7327> clave<WH1692> unto her.
And she said<WH559>, Behold, thy sister in law<WH2994> is gone back<WH7725> unto her people<WH5971>, and unto her gods<WH430>: return<WH7725> thou after<WH310> thy sister in law<WH2994>.

And Ruth<WH7327> said<WH559>, Intreat<WH6293> me not to leave<WH5800> thee, or to return<WH7725> from following after<WH310> thee: for whither thou goest<WH3212>, I will go<WH3212>; and where thou lodgest<WH3885>, I will lodge<WH3885>: thy people<WH5971> shall be my people<WH5971>, and thy God<WH430> my God<WH430>:
Where thou diest<WH4191>, will I die<WH4191>, and there will I be buried<WH6912>: the LORD<WH3068> do<WH6213> so to me, and more<WH3254> also, if ought but death<WH4194> part<WH6504> thee and me.
When she saw<WH7200> that she was stedfastly minded<WH553> to go<WH3212> with her, then she left<WH2308> speaking<WH1696> unto her.

¶ So they two<WH8147> went<WH3212> until they came<WH935> to Beth-lehem<WH1035>. And it came to pass, when they were come<WH935> to Beth-lehem<WH1035>, that all the city<WH5892> was moved<WH1949> about them, and they said<WH559>, Is this Naomi<WH5281>?
And she said<WH559> unto them, Call<WH7121> me not Naomi<WH5281>, call<WH7121> me Mara<WH4755>: for the Almighty<WH7706> hath dealt very<WH3966> bitterly<WH4843> with me.

I went out<WH1980> full<WH4392>, and the LORD<WH3068> hath brought me home again<WH7725> empty<WH7387>: why then call<WH7121> ye me Naomi<WH5281>, seeing the LORD<WH3068> hath testified<WH6030> against me, and the Almighty<WH7706> hath afflicted<WH7489> me?

So Naomi<WH5281> returned<WH7725>, and Ruth<WH7327> the Moabitess<WH4125>, her daughter in law<WH3618>, with her, which returned<WH7725> out of the country<WH7704> of Moab<WH4124>: and they came<WH935> to Beth-lehem<WH1035> in the beginning<WH8462> of barley<WH8184> harvest<WH7105>.
